meta.hint:
SSome words have more than one meaning.
Example - The light hurts my eyes. Feathers are very light.
Sometimes the different meanings even sound different.
Example - The actors leaned over and took a bow. (bow rhyme with how). The girl tied a bow in her hair. (bow rhymes with low).
Words with more than one meaning are called multiple-meaning words or homographs.
meta.question: Which sentence matches the definition given?

content.word: Neil wished he knew a spell that would clean his room for him
content.description:
Which sentence uses the meaning of the word given?
Spell -noun a group of magic words.
content.extra: Neil wished he knew a spell that would clean his room for him, Please spell the word Kangaroo.

content.word: The new light in our kitchen is very bright.
content.description:
Which sentence uses the meaning of the word given?
Light -noun something that helps you see in the dark.
content.extra: The new light in our kitchen is very bright,  This box is so light that I can carry it myself.

content.word: A brown bear may eat up to 40 kilograms of food every day.
content.description:
Which sentence uses the meaning of the word given?
Bear -noun a large, furry animal that sleeps in the winter.
content.extra: A brown bear may eat up to 40 kilograms of food every day,  Helly couldn't bear it when she sang.

content.word: Anny wore a yellow bow in her hair.
content.description:
Which sentence uses the meaning of the word given?
Bow -noun a tied ribbon.
content.extra: Anny wore a yellow bow in her hair, At the end of the play we'll all walk on the stage and bow.

content.description:
Which sentence uses the meaning of the word given?
Dress -noun a kind of clothing.
content.extra: I'll buy this pink dress.,  In the winter I always dress up warmly with a hat coat and gloves.
